definitions.example: Many editors say they don't want stories written in rhyme.

definitions.definition: A thought expressed in verse; a verse; a poem; a tale told in verse.
A word that rhymes with another.
definitions.example: Norse poetry is littered with rhymes like "sól ... sunnan".

definitions.definition: Rhyming: sameness of sound of part of some words.
definitions.example: The poem exhibits a peculiar form of rhyme.

definitions.definition: To compose or treat in verse; versify.
(followed by with) Of a word, to be pronounced identically with another from the vowel in its stressed syllable to the end.
Of two or more words, to be pronounced identically from the vowel in the stressed syllable of each to the end of each.
definitions.example: "India" and "windier" rhyme with each other in non-rhotic accents.
